titlestmt.titleproper: Presbyterian Association of Baltimore City records 1891-1938
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Presbyterian Association of Baltimore City records

bioghist.p: The Presbyterian Association of Baltimore City managed property and financial assets of member churches. Among the responsibilities of the Association was the "Glendy Burying Ground," management of which had been turned over to the Association by the Second Presbyterian Church of Baltimore in 1875.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records of the Presbyterian Association of Baltimore City. Materials include two volumes of minutes of the Association's Board of Managers, 1904-1913 and 1920-1939. Many of the minutes relate to church property and financial assets of member churches. The first volume includes a copy of the Association's by-laws, and lists of managers and committee members. The collection also includes a volume of sexton's permits for internment in the Glendy Burial Ground, 1891-1910, comprising 66 permits. Permits list name, date, and lot number.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
